add

public Panel add(Component comp)
Adds a component to the content panel of the currently selected tab. This method returns a reference to the currently selected content panel, allowing subsequent adds.

add in class Panel

comp - compenent to add
layout - position of the compenent in the panel

addListener

public void addListener(TabSelectedListener tabSelectedListener)
Adds a TabSelectedListener to the tabs. The listener is called whenever the tab other then ccuurent is selected.
See Also:
TabSelectedListener, TabSelectedEvent

addTab

public int addTab(java.lang.String tabTitle)
Creates a tab marked with a string title.
Parameters:
tabTitle - title of the tab to be added.

getTabContent

public Panel getTabContent(int tabIndex)
Each tab has a content panel associated with it. This method returns content panel for a given tab, or null, if there is no content panel for this tab.
Parameters:
tabIndex - index of the tab
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if tabIndex is not within a number of tabs, or if tab with tabIndex wasn't created yet.
See Also:
setTabContent(int, viewtier.ui.Panel)

getTabCount

public int getTabCount()
Return number of tabs in a tab panel.
Returns:
current number of tabs in the tab panel or zero if there are no tabs defined.

remove

public Component remove(Component comp)
Removes component from the content panel of the currently selected tab. This method returns a reference to the deleted component.
Overrides:
remove in class Panel
Parameters:
comp - component to remove from currenly selected tab content panel
See Also:
Component

removeTab

public void removeTab(int tabIndex)
Removes a tab.
Parameters:
tabIndex - index of the tab to be removed.

selectTab

public void selectTab(int tabIndex)
Selects tab.

setTabAlignment

public void setTabAlignment(int align)
Sets alignment of tab headers.
Parameters:
align - defines alignment of tab headers. It can be
  • Layout.LEFT - tabs are aligned to the left side of the tab panel
  • Layout.RIGHT - tabs are aligned to the right side of the tab panel
  • Layout.JUSTIFY - tabs are spreaded evenly between left and right edges of the tab panel
By default tab headers are aligned to the left.

setTabContent

public Tabs setTabContent(int tabIndex,
                          Panel contentPanel)
Each tab should have a content panel associated with it. Tab's content panel holds other components belonging to a tab. This method sets a content panel for the given tab. If the content panel is already set, replaces that panel.
Parameters:
tabIndex - index of the tab.
contentPanel - tab's content panel to hold components belonging to the tab.
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if tabIndex is not within a number of tabs, or if tab with tabIndex wasn't created yet.
See Also:
addTab(java.lang.String), getTabContent(int), Panel

setTabHeight

public void setTabHeight(int height)
Sets height of an area containing tabs.
Parameters:
height - of an area containing tabs in pixels. Default is 20. Minimum tab height is 10.
